availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Active Militia Records - Capital Guards, North Cumberland Btn., and Three Forks Btn.
msIdentifier.idno: Box 76, Folder 864 1st REGT CAPITAL GUARDS CO H Frankfort Bn RECRUITING & RAISING CO

body.p:
HEAD-QUARTERS KENT'Y STATE GUARD,
Inspector General's Office.
Frankfort, Ky., June 17th 1864.
Authority is hereby given to Capts Sanford Goins and Albert Bayless to raise a company of Eighty-three (83) men to be used as a Battery in the State Guard service. --

D. W. Lindsey
Ins. Genl of Ky

It is agreed that if Capts Goins and Bayless raise forty-two (42) men -- the number required by the State Guard Law -- the Company will be mustered into the State Guard Service, and it will be allowed a corresponding number of officers -- say a Capt and Lieut. --

D. W. Lindsey
Ins. Genl of Ky

Sanford Goins Capt Coy H. June 3. 1864
Barnard Mattingly 1 Lt. Coy H. July 5. 1864

Capitol Guard
Capitol Guard
Goin Sanford
Capt.
Mattingly B.
1 Lt.
Issue coms as capt to S. Goins to date from 1s Enlistment. To Mattingly as 1s Lt to date from date of 42d Enlistment.
